alert.note: Alert for Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:06PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Coos County through 245 PM EDT... At 206 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lancaster, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Lancaster, Carroll, Jefferson, Randolph, Whitefield, Northumberland, Stark and Milan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
